recipes.title: Classic Protein Brownies Recipe
recipes.description: A delicious and easy-to-make classic protein brownie recipe with 20g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, applesauce, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs.
Let the brownies cool completely in the pan before cutting into 12 squares.

recipes.title: High Protein Brownies
recipes.description: These high-protein brownies pack a whopping 25g of protein per serving, perfect for a post-workout treat.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the whey and casein protein powders, coconut flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, baking powder, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs and Greek yogurt until smooth. Then, stir in the melted dark chocolate.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until a thick batter forms.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the edges are set and the center is slightly fudgy.
Allow the brownies to cool completely before slicing and serving.

recipes.title: Protein Powder Brownies
recipes.description: A simple and delicious brownie recipe that puts protein powder front and center. 18g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the protein powder, flour, cocoa powder, brown sugar, and baking soda.
In another bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and stir until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 20-22 minutes.
Let the brownies cool before cutting into squares.

recipes.title: Cottage Cheese Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Creamy, moist, and packed with 22g of protein, these cottage cheese brownies are a game-changer.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a blender, combine the cottage cheese, eggs, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. Blend until completely smooth.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, cocoa powder, coconut flour, and baking soda.
Pour the blended wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25-28 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Healthy Protein Brownies
recipes.description: A guilt-free brownie recipe with 15g of protein, made with wholesome ingredients.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease an 8x8 inch pan.
In a bowl, combine oat flour, protein powder, cocoa powder, coconut sugar, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk eggs, mashed banana, and almond milk.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir until just combined.
Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
Cool before cutting into 12 brownies.

recipes.title: Whey Protein Brownies Recipe
recipes.description: A classic brownie recipe specifically designed for whey protein, delivering 19g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, applesauce, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Do not overmix.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with moist crumbs.
Let the brownies cool completely in the pan before cutting into 12 squares.

recipes.title: Sweet Potato Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Moist, fudgy, and secretly healthy protein brownies made with sweet potato. 16g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the mashed sweet potato, protein powder, cocoa powder, almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and baking soda.
Stir until all ingredients are well combined and a thick batter forms.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread it out evenly.
Bake for 28-30 minutes, or until the center is set.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Chocolate Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Intensely chocolatey protein brownies for the ultimate chocolate lover. 21g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, cocoa powder, almond flour, and sweetener.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and Greek yogurt. Then, stir in the melted dark chocolate.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
Let the brownies cool before cutting and enjoying.

recipes.title: Black Bean Protein Brownies
recipes.description: You won't believe these fudgy, decadent brownies are made with black beans! 17g of protein per serving.
ingredients: 425g can of black beans, rinsed and drained

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a blender or food processor, combine all ingredients. Blend until completely smooth.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Optional: sprinkle some chocolate chips on top before baking.
Bake for 23-25 minutes, or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Let the brownies cool completely in the pan before slicing.

recipes.title: Banana Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Naturally sweetened with banana, these protein brownies are moist and delicious. 15g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, mix together the mashed bananas, eggs, protein powder, cocoa powder, oat flour, peanut butter, and baking powder.
Stir until the batter is smooth and well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 22-25 minutes, or until the center is set.
Let the brownies cool before cutting into squares.

recipes.title: Vegan Protein Brownies
recipes.description: A delicious and fudgy vegan protein brownie recipe with 18g of plant-based protein.
ingredients: 2 flax eggs (2 tbsp ground flaxseed + 6 tbsp water)

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch pan. Prepare the flax eggs by mixing ground flaxseed and water, and let it sit for 5-10 minutes to thicken.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, and coconut sugar.
In a separate bowl, mash the avocado until smooth. Then, stir in the flax eggs and almond milk.
Add the wet ingredients to the dry and mix until a thick batter forms.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25-28 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Fudgy Protein Brownies
recipes.description: The ultimate fudgy protein brownies, rich and decadent with 20g of protein.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 325°F (165°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, cocoa powder, coconut flour, sweetener, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and melted butter until well combined.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until a thick, fudgy batter forms. Fold in the dark chocolate chips.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 22-25 minutes. The center should be slightly undercooked for maximum fudginess.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Pumpkin Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Enjoy the flavors of fall with these moist and delicious pumpkin protein brownies. 16g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the pumpkin puree, eggs, protein powder, cocoa powder, oat flour, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice, and baking soda.
Stir until all ingredients are well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 28-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Let the brownies cool before slicing.

recipes.title: Low Calorie Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Enjoy a delicious brownie for under 140 calories, with a solid 15g of protein.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Lightly grease an 8x8 inch pan.
In a bowl, combine protein powder, cocoa powder, oat flour, sweetener, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk egg whites, applesauce, and almond milk.
Add wet ingredients to dry and stir until just combined.
Pour batter into the prepared pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
Cool before cutting into 12 brownies.

recipes.title: Protein Blondies
recipes.description: A chewy and delicious protein blondie recipe with 18g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, almond flour, brown sugar substitute, baking soda, and salt.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, melted coconut oil, and vanilla extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in the white chocolate chips.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly. Bake for 20-25 minutes.
Let the blondies cool completely in the pan before cutting.

recipes.title: No-Bake Protein Brownie Bars
recipes.description: Quick, easy, and delicious no-bake protein brownie bars with 15g of protein.

instructions.text: Line an 8x8 inch pan with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, combine the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, peanut butter, honey/maple syrup, and almond milk.
Stir until a thick, uniform dough forms. If the mixture is too dry, add a little more almond milk.
Press the mixture evenly into the prepared pan.
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to set.
Cut into 10 bars and store in the refrigerator.

recipes.title: Single-Serving Protein Brownie
recipes.description: A quick and easy single-serving protein brownie you can make in the microwave. 25g of protein.

instructions.text: In a microwave-safe mug, whisk together the protein powder, cocoa powder, sweetener, and baking powder.
Add the egg and milk to the mug.
Stir until the batter is smooth and there are no lumps.
Microwave on high for 60-90 seconds, or until the brownie is cooked through.
Let it cool for a minute before enjoying.

recipes.title: Keto Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Low-carb, high-fat keto protein brownies with 18g of protein and only 4g of net carbs.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, combine the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, and erythritol.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs and melted butter.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until a thick batter forms. Fold in the sugar-free chocolate chips.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Greek Yogurt Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Moist and tangy protein brownies made with Greek yogurt, packing 23g of protein.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, oat flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, and baking powder.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, Greek yogurt, and vanilla extract until smooth.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 25-28 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Avocado Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Incredibly fudgy and healthy protein brownies made with avocado. 19g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a blender or food processor, combine the mashed avocado, eggs, protein powder, cocoa powder, maple syrup, vanilla, and baking soda. Blend until smooth.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Optional: sprinkle with chocolate chips.
Bake for 22-25 minutes, or until the center is set.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Zucchini Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Shredded zucchini adds moisture and nutrients to these delicious protein brownies. 16g of protein per serving.
ingredients: 150g shredded zucchini, squeezed of excess moisture

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
Shred the zucchini and squeeze out as much moisture as possible with a clean kitchen towel.
In a large bowl, combine the shredded zucchini, eggs, protein powder, cocoa powder, oat flour, coconut sugar, melted coconut oil, and baking powder.
Stir until all ingredients are well combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 28-30 minutes.
Let the brownies cool before slicing.

recipes.title: Peanut Butter Protein Brownies
recipes.description: The perfect combination of chocolate and peanut butter in a high-protein brownie. 22g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, peanut butter powder, cocoa powder, and sweetener.
In a separate bowl, whisk the eggs, Greek yogurt, and creamy peanut butter until smooth.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until a thick batter forms.
Spread the batter into the prepared pan. Optional: swirl in extra peanut butter on top. Bake for 22-25 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Mint Chocolate Protein Brownies
recipes.description: A refreshing and delicious mint chocolate protein brownie with 20g of protein.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, and sweetener.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, applesauce, melted coconut oil, and peppermint extract.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Raspberry Swirl Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Fudgy chocolate protein brownies with a beautiful and delicious raspberry swirl. 19g of protein.

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, oat flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, baking soda, eggs, and Greek yogurt until a thick batter forms.
Pour the brownie batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Dollop the mashed raspberries over the top of the batter. Use a knife to gently swirl the raspberries into the brownie batter.
Bake for 25-28 minutes, or until the center is set.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Espresso Protein Brownies
recipes.description: A rich and fudgy protein brownie with a kick of espresso. 20g of protein per serving.

instructions.text: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and line an 8x8 inch baking pan.
In a large bowl, whisk together the protein powder, almond flour, cocoa powder, sweetener, espresso powder, and baking soda.
In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, applesauce, and melted coconut oil.
Pour the wet ingredients into the dry and mix until just combined.
Pour the batter into the prepared pan and bake for 22-25 minutes.
Let the brownies cool completely before slicing.

recipes.title: Gluten-Free Black Bean Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Fudgy, rich brownies made with black beans for a naturally gluten-free base. You won't believe these decadent treats are packed with protein and fiber!
ingredients: 400g canned black beans, drained and rinsed

instructions.text: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F). Line an 8x8 inch baking pan with parchment paper.
Add black beans, eggs, maple syrup, nut butter, and vanilla to a food processor. Blend until completely smooth.
Add the protein powder, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. Blend until combined.
Fold in the chocolate chips. Pour batter into the prepared pan and spread evenly.
Bake for 22-25 minutes until set but still slightly fudgy in the center. Cool completely before cutting into 12 brownies.

recipes.title: Dairy-Free Avocado Protein Brownies
recipes.description: Ultra-fudgy dairy-free brownies made with avocado for healthy fats and incredible texture. No butter, no milk, all delicious!
ingredients: 2 flax eggs (2 tbsp ground flaxseed + 6 tbsp water)

instructions.text: Mix ground flaxseed with water and let sit for 5 minutes until gel-like.
In a food processor, blend the avocado until completely smooth with no lumps.
Add the coconut sugar, almond milk, flax eggs, and vanilla to the avocado. Blend until smooth.
Add protein powder, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt. Blend until combined. Fold in chocolate chips.
Pour into a parchment-lined 8x8 pan. Bake at 175°C (350°F) for 22-25 minutes. Cool completely before slicing.
